[[File:Cormorant Moon - Ballard Locks - Seattle, Washington.jpg|175px|Lona is a goddess of the [[Moon]]|thumb]] In [[Hawaiian mythology]], '''Lona''' is a female [[lunar deity]] who fell in love with and married a mortal, [[Aikanaka (mythology)|ʻAikanaka]]. They lived happily together until ʻAikanaka died of old age.<ref>''Pacific mythology: an encyclopedia of myth and legend'' by [[Jan Knappert]]</ref><ref>''Academic Dictionary Of Mythology'' by [[Ramesh Chopra]]</ref> == Lona and other deities == It is likely that Lona is just another name for the Moon goddess [[Hina (goddess)|Hina]].<ref>Beckwith, pp. 214-25</ref> A Hawaiian god with the similar name is [[Lono]]. == Notes == {{Reflist}} [[Category:Hawaiian mythology]] [[Category:Lunar goddesses]]
